newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: RUGBY UNION-IRELAND V ITALY GAME TO GO AHEAD DESPITE WEATHER.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-IRELAND V ITALY GAME TO GO AHEAD DESPITE WEATHER.

text.p: Freezing conditions will not prevent Saturday's rugby union international at Lansdowne Road between Ireland and Italy from going ahead, the Irish Rugby Football Union (IRFU) said on Thursday.
The IRFU said a protective covering had been put over the Lansdowne Road pitch after it had snowed in Dublin overnight.
"The cover will protect the pitch and take out any frost that may be in the surface," the IRFU said.

The Italians were expected to undergo a light training session in Dublin after their arrival on Thursday afternoon while the Irish squad were due to arrive back after a winter break in Portugal on Thursday evening.
